title: 106_s986
content: The Act is titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms used within the Act. The Act defines the "Authority" as the Southern Nevada Water Authority and the "Griffith Project" as the Robert B. Griffith Water Project authorized under the Southern Nevada Water Project Act. The terms defined in the document include "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior, "Acquired Land(s)" as all interests in land acquired for the Griffith Project, "Public Land" as lands under Federal ownership, and "Withdrawn Land" as Federal lands reserved from settlement or sale. The curr_chunk states that certain lands are withdrawn from settlement, sale, or mineral location for specific public purposes under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Reclamation or the National Park Service, as per relevant Public Laws. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE OF GRIFFITH PROJECT. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348. The Secretary will convey all rights, title, and interest in project improvements, facilities, and acquired lands to the Authority. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348 and will receive all rights, title, and interest in project improvements, facilities, acquired lands, and reserved interests as per the Act. The Authority shall have a right-of-way across Public Land, Withdrawn Land, and Federal lands necessary for the operation and maintenance of the Griffith Project. The Secretary and the Authority will establish rights-of-way for municipal water supply purposes without requiring payment. Within twelve months, they must agree on the land description and document the rights-of-way. If the conveyance does not occur within twelve months, a report will be submitted to Congress. The Secretary and the Authority have the authority to modify existing contracts and land permits to comply with the provisions of this Act. Additionally, the Act's relationship to other laws and future benefits will be addressed. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, it shall no longer receive Reclamation benefits and will cease to be a Federal Reclamation Project. Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area will not be affected. The Griffith Project will no longer be a Federal Reclamation Project. Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area will remain unaffected. The United States will not be liable for damages after the conveyance of the Griffith Project. After the conveyance of the Griffith Project, the United States will not be liable for damages related to its prior ownership of the conveyed property. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
